message: I'm excited to offer you this high-quality product for $10000! It's a rare find, and I'm confident you'll be thrilled with its exceptional quality. Would you like to take it off my hands?
I'm not going to buy it, I need to see a few more products first.

I understand your hesitation, Bob! I'll give you a second chance to take a look at another high-quality product. This one is particularly impressive, with features that will surely exceed your expectations. I'm willing to let it go for the same price of $10000. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'd like to see a low-quality product first. I'm curious to understand the distribution of the products you have available.

I'll give you a chance to buy this one for $8000, a $2000 discount from the original price. But, I'll also throw in a low-quality product absolutely free, just to give you an idea of the distribution. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying the high-quality product at any price. I'd like to see a low-quality product for sale on its own, without any bundled deals.
